title: Abbeyford Woods Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: Martin Bodman / Okehampton: Brightley Mill
images.caption: Brightley Mill. Former watermill used for the manufacture of kites. On the river on the eastern side of the woods.

images.title: Rowena Ford / Abbeyford Woods, Okehampton
images.caption: The woods in autumn. During the Second world war the woods were a Royal Navy depot. After the war, two buildings were used to store emergency rations in case of Nuclear attack

images.caption: Footpath in summer.

description: These woods in Okehampton have miles of nice cycling and walking trails to try. Abbeyford Woods is located just north of the town next to the River Okement. There's a good sized car park just off the country lane which runs through the centre of the woods. Alternatively you could walk to the woods along the Tarka Trail from Okehampton. It's about a one mile walk from the centre of the town. In the woods you will find wonderful Douglas Fir trees and beech trees. Look out for wildlife including roe or red deer, redstart, pied flycatcher, nightjar and buzzard. It's a lovely place for a shady afternoon stroll or for mountain bikers looking for some trails in Devon. The Tarka Trail runs through the woods so you can continue along this path to extend your exercise. You can also pick up the Granite Way in Okehampton which is a great cycling and walking trail along a disused railway line.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The Crossways Inn is located just west of the woods. The historic pub was a 16th century coaching inn on the main route from Okehampton to Torrington. The pub retains many of the old features, including oak beams and an inglenook fireplace that now contains a wood burner. They also have a nice garden area for warmer days. You can find them at Folly Gate, Okehampton EX20 3AH.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The woods are ideal for a dog walk. You will probably meet other owners on a fine day. The Crossways Inn mentioned above is also dog friendly.

display_address: Inwardleigh, West Devon, Devon, England, EX20 1RN, United Kingdom
